7 - Stripped topsoil load and hauled to nominated stockpile location

Conformance Criteria - Stockpile locations located 40m from watercourses and not exceed 2m in height. Native seeding of topsoil stockpiles as agreed with Company. Topsoil stripping shall be to a depth of 200mm or to the bottom of the grass root zone or as shown on the drawings, whichever is the greater
Specification Clause - C9 of EVAMP001- QVT-PE-PRM-0001

8 - CBR values of subgrades under pavements, buildings & structures
Conformance Criteria - The materials exposed at subgrade level of cuttings are to have a minimum CBR of 3.
○ CBR 2 excavate 150 mm below subgrade level and replace with compacted selected fill (minimum CBR 10).
○ CBR 1 excavate 250 mm below subgrade level and replace with compacted selected fill (minimum CBR 10)
Specification Clause - EVAMP001-BEC- 3920-CV-SPE-0001 rev0 Clause 3.9.4.1 Subgrade Preparation for Structures & Pavement
Verification from Thiess / Inspector: THIESS (Initial) - HP
Verification from Thiess / Inspector: Inspector (Initial) - W

11 - Embankment Construction, Layer Thickness, Placement & Compaction
Conformance Criteria - Depths of layers shall not exceed the capability of the proposed plant and in any case shall not exceed 300mm uncompacted.

○ Layers in the top 300 mm below subgrade level for foundations, including the foundation of generators in Independent Power Provider, shall be compacted to not less than 100% of the maximum dry density (standard compaction) with moisture content +/- 2% of OMC.

○ Layers for Earthpads, the top 150mm of Road Embankments, Foundations in the top 300mm below subgrade level, Pond Embankments, and the Crushed Ore Stockpile to be compacted to 98% of the maximum dry density (standard compaction) with moisture content +/- 2% of OMC.
○ Fill material other than that referred to above shall be compacted to a dry density ratio of not less than 95% of the maximum dry density (standard compaction) with moisture content +/- 2% of OMC.

○ Rockfill or mechanical interlock method shall not be used in areas proposed for buildings and other structural works, nor within a zone 600 mm below subgrade level for road embankments. Minimum thickness of uncompacted layers: Greater of 150mm or 1.5 times the max. rock size. Max. thickness of uncompacted layers shall not exceed those nominated in Table 3-14 of the Bechtel EW Spec.
— Normal level of testing minimum frequency: 1/500m2 & 3/Visit
— Reduced level of testing minimum frequency: 1/1,000m2 & 3/visit
— Normal level of testing minimum frequency: 1/500m2 & 3/Visit
— Reduced level of testing minimum frequency: 1/1,000m2 & 3/visit
— Normal level of testing minimum frequency: 1/500m2 & 3/Visit
— Reduced level of testing minimum frequency: 1/1,000m2 & 3/visit
Verification from Thiess / Inspector: THIESS (Initial) - HP
Verification from Thiess / Inspector: Inspector (Initial) - W
Records or Comments - NATA Test Results Survey Records
Conformance Criteria - The top 300 mm below subgrade level for foundations shall be compacted to not less than 100% maximum dry density (standard compaction).

For subgrades under pavements and buildings / structures, the materials exposed at subgrade level of cuttings are to have a minimum CBR of 8. Should the CBR be less than 8, the following subgrade treatments shall be applied:
○ CBR 2 to 7 – excavate 150 mm below subgrade level and replace with compacted selected fill (minimum CBR 10).
○ CBR 1 – excavate 250 mm below subgrade level and replace with compacted selected fill (minimum CBR 10).

○ Proof rolling of the formation which is to receive structural fill and pavement structure shall be witnessed by a civil/geotechnical engineer to ensure that no soft spots remain in the compacted subgrade. Any areas that show signs of visible movement under the rear axle of an on-highway type 10,000L water truck will be rejected. The rear axle of the water truck shall be loaded to at least 8.0 tonnes and fitted with dual tyres. The minimum tyre pressure of the water truck shall be 600 kPa and the testing shall be conducted at a speed in the range of 3-10km/h. Both the Company and the Contractor’s representatives shall walk alongside the testing water truck to observe any surface deformation.
○ Subgrade Preparation for Structures and Pavement, 3.9.4.3
Verification from Thiess / Inspector: THIESS (Initial) - HP
Verification from Thiess / Inspector: Inspector (Initial) - HP
Records or Comments - NATA Test Results Survey Records, Visual Inspection Record
13 - Structural Fill Construction, Layer Thickness, Placement & Compaction
Conformance Criteria - Depths of layers shall not exceed the capability of the proposed plant and in any case shall not be less than 75mm or exceed 200mm uncompacted.
○ The top 300 mm below subgrade level for foundations shall be compacted to not less than 100% maximum dry density (standard compaction).
Specification Clause - EVAMP001-BEC-3920-CV-SPE-0001 Rev0 Clauses 3.9.4.2 Layer Thickness for Structural Fills, 3.9.4.3 Compaction and Moisture Content

Frequency - In-situ Density, Maximum Dry Density(stan dard compaction) & Density Index Minimum testing frequency: 1 test per 2,500m2 or 1 test per 500m3 distributed evenly through the full depth and area, and 2 per work area, and 1 per change of material
Verification from Thiess / Inspector: THIESS (Initial) - HP
Verification from Thiess / Inspector: Inspector (Initial) - W
Records or Comments - NATA Test Results Survey Records
Conformance Criteria - Survey to be completed of the finished surface to confirm construction as per the lines and levels shown on the drawings in accordance with the following tolerances:
— Adjacent Structure: As per the structure
— Not adjacent structure (apart from those listed in Section 3.11.1.1 & Section 3.11.1.2 of the spec): -50 to +150mm
— Substructure concrete to be placed directly against an excavated vertical surface: -10 to +50mm
— Any point on earthworks surface except any of the above: +/-50mm
— Specification Clause - EVAMP001-BEC-3920-CV-SPE-0001 Rev0 Clause 3.11 Construction Tolerance
Verification from Thiess / Inspector: THIESS (Initial) - HP
Verification from Thiess / Inspector: Inspector (Initial) - HP
